availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thompson L. Burnam (Warren County, Kentucky, merchant, postmaster, and private (C.S.A.))

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, merchant, postmaster, and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John Burnam and Sarah Hines Burnam. Married to Sarah D. Hampton in Warren County, Kentucky, on December 1, 1851. Father of William Burnam and Carrie Burnam. Graduate of the University of the State of Missouri in Madison County, Kentucky, in 1846. Merchant in Madison County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned seventeen enslaved persons in Madison County in 1850. Household owned an additional eight enslaved persons in Madison County in 1850. United States postmaster general in Warren County in 1854. Merchant in Warren County in 1860. Owned thirteen enslaved persons in Warren County in 1860. Served in the First Kentucky Helm's Cavalry (C.S.A.) as private from 1861 to 1862.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 3 p. 505.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Warren County Marriages, Film #000242961.
